intro: Marcgravia yukunarum, commonly known as the Yukuna starleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, star-like flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on tree canopies. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
